document.docAuthor: Domahovski, Alexandre Cruz & Cavichioli, Rodney Ramiro
document.docTitle: Polana (Varpulana) vulgaris Domahovski & Cavichioli, 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Six new Brazilian species of Polana (Varpulana) (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Gyponini) with key to males

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 92–96. Color variations of
P. (F.) vulgaris
sp. nov.
specimens: 92, live specimen coloration. 93–96, four different intensities of coloration: 93, more pigmented pattern. 94, more common pattern. 95, less pigmented pattern (without transversal dark-brown band). 96, less pigmented pattern (without transversal dark-brown band and black maculae on costal margin).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology. The specific epithet,
vulgaris
(noun in apposition), was chosen because this is a very common species in the locality where it was collected.

" Brasil , Paraná , S.[São] J.[José] dos\ Pinhais , 25°36'18"S \ 49°11'37"W
880m
\
09–23.ii.2012
malaise\ A. C. Domahovski leg." ( DZUP )
;

♂,

, same data as the holotype ( DZUP )

( DZUP )

( DZUP )

24.iii.2012
( DZUP )
.

Remarks.
Polana (V.) vulgaris
sp. nov.
is similar to
P. (V.) bidens
and
P. (V.) tulara
in the shape of aedeagus with sigmoid shaft, without apical or subapical processes and translucent apex. However, it differs in having the aedeagus with atrial processes unbranched apically and the shaft with basal processes bifid apically. The aedeagal shaft lacks processes at mid-length, as in
P. (V.) bidens
and
P. (V.) tulara
.
